questions.text: Maximum secretion of IGF-1 one is from which of the following?
Glucose is transported across intestinal lumen via which of the following?
All of the following statements about counter current multiplier are true except-

options.label: A
options.text: Descending limb is highly permeable to water

options.label: B
options.text: Thick ascending limb is permeable to Sodium and chloride

options.label: C
options.text: Descending thin limb is impermeable to water

options.label: D
options.text: Descending limb is moderately permeable to urea

questions.correct_answer: C. Descending thin limb is impermeable to water

questions.text: ‘c wave’ in JVP is caused by which of the following?

options.label: A
options.text: Bulging of AV valve during isovolumetric contraction

options.label: C
options.text: Flow of blood from left ventricular to aorta

questions.correct_answer: A. Bulging of AV valve during isovolumetric contraction

questions.text: Which of the following does not cause an increase in aldosterone level?
Release of synaptic vesicles from the presynaptic terminals is inhibited by which of the following?

options.label: B
options.text: Inhibition of conduction of nerve impulse

questions.text: Proprioreceptors for joint and position sense are which of the following?

True about decorticate rigidity is which of the following?

options.label: A
options.text: Removal of cerebral cortex and mid brain

options.label: B
options.text: Flexion of lower limbs and extension of upper limbs

options.label: C
options.text: Rigidity is less pronounced than decerebrate rigidity

questions.correct_answer: C. Rigidity is less pronounced than decerebrate rigidity

options.label: B

options.label: D

questions.text: Impaired function of acquaporinsresults in which of the following?

options.label: C
options.text: Normal person after wakening in the morning

questions.correct_answer: C. Normal person after wakening in the morning

questions.text: A young man met with a motorbike accident in which he sustains an abdominal injury. His entire ileum and partial jejunum were resected. Which of the following will the patient likely to suffer from?

A 50-year-old man presents with paresthesia. Peripheral smear shows macrocytes and neutrophils with hypersegmentednuclei. Endoscopy reveals atopic gastritis. Which of the following deficiency is most likely to be the cause of the patient’s problems?

A 40-year-old patient with ptosis and fatigue which worsens towards the end of the day is likely to have which of the following?

Cardiovascular findings in a patient are as follows:-large ‘a’ wave on JVP, mid-diastolic murmur, pedal edema. The most probable diagnosis is which of the following?
Which of the following is true regarding the following diagram?

options.label: A
options.text: Segment Iais a manifestation of the La Place’s law

options.label: B
options.text: Segment Ibis a manifestation of the La Place’s law

options.label: C
options.text: Dashed line indicates micturition has occurred

options.label: D
options.text: Micturition Is inhibited in phase II

questions.correct_answer: B. Segment Ibis a manifestation of the La Place’s law

questions.text: A 35-year-old patient present with paresis and numbness after sleeping overnight with the arm under his head. Saturday night palsy is due to increased susceptibility of which of the following nerve fibers to pressure?

options.label: A
options.text: Type A nerve fibers are most susceptible to pressure that type C nerve fibers

options.label: B
options.text: Type C nerve fibers are most susceptible to pressure than type A nerve fibers

options.label: C
options.text: Type B nerve fibers are more susceptible to pressure than type C fibers

options.label: D
options.text: Type B nerve fibers are most susceptible to pressure than type A fibers

questions.correct_answer: A. Type A nerve fibers are most susceptible to pressure that type C nerve fibers

questions.text: The following diagram shows changes in hypothalamic set point and body temperature. What changes will be seen at A compared to B?

A man was brought to the emergency after he suddenly became unconscious while working in the field. On examination, his temperature was 105 degrees Fahrenheit and his skin turgor was reduced. Which of the following will not be seen in this patient?
Identify the correctly matched pair of substances with their renal clearance from the graph given below-

options.label: A
options.text: A- Glucose B- PAH C- Biacarbonate D- Inulin

options.label: B
options.text: A- Inulin B- Bicarbonate C- Glucose D- PAH

options.label: C
options.text: A- Glucose B- Inulin C- Bicarbonate D- PAH

options.label: D
options.text: A- Glucose B- Bicarbonate C- Inulin D- PAH

questions.correct_answer: D. A- Glucose B- Bicarbonate C- Inulin D- PAH

questions.text: Identify the true statement regarding the given nerve action potential curve.

options.label: B
options.text: At point E, the nerve is more excitable

options.label: C
options.text: Point C to D is due to opening of Na+ and closure of K+ channels

options.label: D
options.text: Point B to D is refractory period.

questions.correct_answer: D. Point B to D is refractory period.

questions.text: Identify the type of transport across the cell membrane given below-
What is true about the surface tension and compliance in a preterm baby delivered at 28 weeks who developed Respiratory distress syndrome?

options.label: A
options.text: Both surface tension and compliance decreased.

options.label: B
options.text: Both surface tension and compliance increased.

options.label: C
options.text: Surface tension decreased and compliance increased

options.label: D
options.text: Surface tension increased and compliance decreased

questions.correct_answer: D. Surface tension increased and compliance decreased

questions.text: In a patient with severe muscle injury and serum K+ level 5.5 mEq/L, what will happen to the resting membrane potential in this patient?

options.label: D
options.text: First becomes more positive then negative

questions.text: A patient met with an RTA and developed a cervical spine injury. The lateral aspect of the dorsal column is injured. Which of the following findings are seen in this patient?

options.label: C
options.text: Absence of ipsilateral lower limb proprioception

options.label: D
options.text: Absence of fine motor movement of fingers

questions.correct_answer: A. Absence of ipsilateral arm proprioception

questions.text: Identify the true statement regarding the point marked on the myocardial action potential curve.

options.label: B
options.text: Due to closure of Na+ and opening of slow K+ channels

options.label: C
options.text: Due to slow but prolonged opening of Ca2+ channels

options.label: D
options.text: Due to opening of Na+ and closure of fast K+ channels

questions.correct_answer: C. Due to slow but prolonged opening of Ca2+ channels

questions.text: Which tongue papillae does not have taste buds?

A patient is experiencing phantom limb pain after amputation of right limb. What is observed on a PET scan in a patient with phantom limb pain?

options.label: A
options.text: Projection of adjacent fibers overlap to right sensory cortex

options.label: B
options.text: Projection of adjacent fibers of left somatosensory area extending into right hand area

questions.correct_answer: B. Projection of adjacent fibers of left somatosensory area extending into right hand area

questions.text: A men having difficulty in sleep during night. He has habit of drinking coffee 1 hour before bedtime. What is the role of caffeine in wakefulness?

options.label: A
options.text: Blocks adenosine action and cause wakefulness

options.label: B
options.text: Activate locus coeruleus and cause wakefulness

options.label: D
options.text: Activates histamine release and prevent sleep

questions.correct_answer: A. Blocks adenosine action and cause wakefulness

questions.text: Which ion is most responsible for the resting membrane potential (RMP)?

A women had suffer sun burn when enjoying a vacation on beach. Now while taking a shower, the lukewarm water (40°C) touching her back caused her to feel pain. What types of receptors were activated by the lukewarm water and why did she experience pain?
questions.correct_answer: D. Innocuous thermal receptors and allodynia

questions.text: Which receptor helps in improvement of insulin resistance in DM2 with regular exercise and physical activities? (Part A)

A 50-year-old female presented with dyspnoea and chest pain. Which of the following proves that she has aortic stenosis than aortic regurgitation?

options.label: A
options.text: Increase in myocardial oxygen consumption is seen with increased pressure work

options.label: B
options.text: Aortic stenosis causes reduced pressure at aortic valve

options.label: C
options.text: Workload has nothing to do with myocardial oxygen consumption

options.label: D
options.text: Increase in preload more than afterload in aortic stenosis

questions.correct_answer: A. Increase in myocardial oxygen consumption is seen with increased pressure work
